titleStmt.title: The true copie of a letter sent from an inhabitant of Bridgewater in the county of Somerset which is now under the command of His Majesties forces unto a quartermaster of a troope of horse belonging to the westerne brigade : wherein is set forth the certainty of the landing of 1000 Irish rebels at Mynehead in the said county and of divers others landed at Bristol : together with the governour of Bridgewater his speech to restraine the garrison Souldiers from going to Mynehead to suppresse the progresse of the rebels.
titleStmt.author: Davy, Henry.

notesStmt.note: At end: Bridgewater October 27, 1643. Hen. Davy.
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
